title: [Quick fix] Add CUDA support for arange
body_html:
Since fb32164 , arange now has a dedicated C implementation in TH that uses range internally, instead of relying on cwrap to perform the range modification.
But even though range has a CUDA implementation, there was no THC implementation for arange. It would roughly consist of almost the exact same code as arange for the CPU, and we should also modify the cwrap to work on both CPU and GPU

body:
Since https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commit/fb32164a72004e63ebfe1f9ca8366ff12f8fbec2 , `arange` now has a dedicated C implementation in TH that uses `range` internally, instead of relying on cwrap to perform the range modification.
But even though [`range` has a CUDA implementation](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/lib/THC/generic/THCTensorMath.cu#L435-L450), there was no THC implementation for `arange`. It would roughly consist of almost the exact same code as `arange` for the CPU, and we should also modify the cwrap to work on both [CPU and GPU](https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/blob/master/torch/csrc/generic/methods/Tensor.cwrap#L692)
